      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>

          <identifier>

            <entry>cahi1:data_115048</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Hydrogen bonding in water molecules</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Wasserstoffabbinden in den Wassermolekülen</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Liaison d'hydrogène en molécules d'eau</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Ligação do hidrogênio em moléculas de água</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Bonding dell'idrogeno in molecole di acqua</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Σύνδεση υδρογόνου στα μόρια ύδατος</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Vinculación del hidrógeno en moléculas de agua</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">This illustration shows the chemical structure of water where hydrogen bonds occur between hydrogen atoms having a partial positive charge and oxygen atoms with high electronegativity.</string>
          </description>
          <language>x-none</language>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Atoms</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">chemical structure</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">electronegativity</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">hydrogen bonds</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">molecules</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">oxygen</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">positive charge</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">water</string>
          </keyword>
          <structure>
            <source>structureValues</source>
            <value>atomic</value>
          </structure>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Diese Abbildung zeigt die chemische Struktur des 
Wassers, in dem Wasserstoffbindungen zwischen den Wasserstoffatomen 
auftreten, die eine teilweise positive Ladung haben und den 
Sauerstoffatomen mit hohem electronegativity.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Cette illustration montre la structure chimique de
l'eau où les obligations d'hydrogène se produisent entre les atomes
d'hydrogène ayant une charge positive partielle et les atomes 
d'oxygène avec le haut electronegativity.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Esta ilustração mostra a estrutura química da 
água onde as ligações do hidrogênio ocorrem entre os átomos do 
hidrogênio que têm uma carga positiva parcial e os átomos de 
oxigênio com electronegativity elevado.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Questa illustrazione mostra la struttura chimica 
di acqua in cui i legami dell'idrogeno si presentano fra gli atomi 
dell'idrogeno che hanno una carica positiva parziale e gli atomi di 
ossigeno con l'alto electronegativity.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Αυτή η απεικόνιση εμφανίζει χημική δομή του ύδατος 
όπου οι δεσμοί υδρογόνου εμφανίζονται μεταξύ των ατόμων 
υδρογόνου που έχουν μια μερική θετική δαπάνη και των ατόμων 
οξυγόνου με το υψηλό electronegativity.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Esta ilustración muestra la estructura química 
del agua donde los enlaces del hidrógeno ocurren entre los átomos 
del hidrógeno que tienen una carga positiva parcial y los átomos de 
oxígeno con electronegativity alto.</string>
          </description>
